summary: This document is an invoice from FedEx addressed to Jeffrey E. Epstein for shipping services. It details charges related to a shipment made on November 13, 2002, and includes information about customs duties and taxes paid by FedEx on behalf of Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the recipient of the invoice for shipping services provided by FedEx, indicating his involvement in international shipping activities.

persons.name: Sherman Valdson Cotrin
persons.context: Sherman Valdson Cotrin is mentioned as the shipper associated with the shipment referenced in the invoice.

connections.description: Sherman Valdson Cotrin is identified as the shipper for a package sent by Jeffrey E. Epstein, indicating a business relationship.

events.title: Shipment Made
events.description: A shipment was made by Jeffrey E. Epstein via FedEx, which is detailed in the invoice.

events.title: Customs Entry
events.description: The customs entry for the shipment was recorded, indicating the involvement of customs duties and taxes.

keyFacts: The invoice is dated November 21, 2002, and pertains to a shipment made on November 13, 2002.
The total charges for the shipment amount to $137.13.
Customs duties and taxes were paid by FedEx on behalf of Jeffrey E. Epstein for the shipment.
Sherman Valdson Cotrin is listed as the shipper associated with Epstein's shipment.
The document includes references to international shipping and customs processes.
